trans-unit.source: Add apps for Windows PCs that run the Intune software client| Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Add apps for Windows PCs that run the Intune software client| Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to learn how to add apps for Windows PCs to Intune before you deploy them.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to learn how to add apps for Windows PCs to Intune before you deploy them.

trans-unit.source: Add apps for Windows PCs that run the Intune software client
trans-unit.target: Add apps for Windows PCs that run the Intune software client

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to learn how to add apps to Intune before you deploy them.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to learn how to add apps to Intune before you deploy them.

trans-unit.source: The information in this topic helps you add apps for Windows PCs that you manage by using the Intune software client.
trans-unit.target: The information in this topic helps you add apps for Windows PCs that you manage by using the Intune software client.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add apps for enrolled Windows PCs and other mobile devices, see [Add apps for mobile devices in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: If you want to add apps for enrolled Windows PCs and other mobile devices, see [Add apps for mobile devices in Microsoft Intune](add-apps-for-mobile-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Add the app
trans-unit.target: Add the app

trans-unit.source: You use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and upload it to your cloud storage space by using the following procedure:
trans-unit.target: You use the Intune Software Publisher to configure the properties of the app and upload it to your cloud storage space by using the following procedure:

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administrator console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Add Apps** to start the Intune Software Publisher.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administrator console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Add Apps** to start the Intune Software Publisher.

trans-unit.source: You might need to enter your Intune user name and password before the publisher starts.
trans-unit.target: You might need to enter your Intune user name and password before the publisher starts.

trans-unit.source: On the **Software setup** page of the publisher, under **Select how this software is made available to devices**, choose **Software installer**, and then specify:
trans-unit.target: On the **Software setup** page of the publisher, under **Select how this software is made available to devices**, choose **Software installer**, and then specify:

trans-unit.source: **Select the software installer file type**.
trans-unit.target: **Select the software installer file type**.

trans-unit.source: This indicates the type of software that you want to deploy.
trans-unit.target: This indicates the type of software that you want to deploy.

trans-unit.source: For a Windows PC, choose **Windows Installer**.
trans-unit.target: For a Windows PC, choose **Windows Installer**.

trans-unit.source: **Specify the location of the software setup files**.
trans-unit.target: **Specify the location of the software setup files**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the location of the installation files, or choose **Browse** to select the location from a list.
trans-unit.target: Enter the location of the installation files, or choose **Browse** to select the location from a list.

trans-unit.source: **Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder**.
trans-unit.target: **Include additional files and subfolders from the same folder**.

trans-unit.source: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files.
trans-unit.target: Some software that uses Windows Installer requires supporting files.

trans-unit.source: These are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.
trans-unit.target: These are typically found in the same folder as the installation files.

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you also want to deploy these supporting files.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you also want to deploy these supporting files.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to publish an app named Application.msi to Intune, the page would look like this: ![Software setup page of the publisher](./media/publisher-for-pc.png)
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to publish an app named Application.msi to Intune, the page would look like this: ![Software setup page of the publisher](./media/publisher-for-pc.png)

trans-unit.source: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.
trans-unit.target: This installation type uses some of your cloud storage space.

trans-unit.source: On the **Software description** page, configure the following.
trans-unit.target: On the **Software description** page, configure the following.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the installer file that you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered, or they might not appear.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the installer file that you are using, some of these values might have been automatically entered, or they might not appear.

trans-unit.source: **Publisher**.
trans-unit.target: **Publisher**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the publisher of the app.

trans-unit.source: **Name**.
trans-unit.target: **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the app as it will be displayed in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: Make sure all app names that you use are unique.
trans-unit.target: Make sure all app names that you use are unique.

trans-unit.source: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: If the same app name exists twice, only one of the apps will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Description**.
trans-unit.target: **Description**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a description for the app.
trans-unit.target: Enter a description for the app.

trans-unit.source: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **URL for software information** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **URL for software information** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Enter the URL of a website that contains information about this app.
trans-unit.target: Enter the URL of a website that contains information about this app.

trans-unit.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Privacy URL** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **Privacy URL** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Enter the URL of a website that contains privacy information for this app.
trans-unit.target: Enter the URL of a website that contains privacy information for this app.

trans-unit.source: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.
trans-unit.target: The URL will be displayed to users in the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Category** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **Category** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Select one of the built-in app categories.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the built-in app categories.

trans-unit.source: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This will make it easier for users to find the app when they browse the company portal.

trans-unit.source: **Icon** (optional).
trans-unit.target: **Icon** (optional).

trans-unit.source: Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.
trans-unit.target: Upload an icon that will be associated with the app.

trans-unit.source: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.
trans-unit.target: This is the icon that will be displayed with the app when users browse the company portal.

trans-unit.source: On the **Requirements** page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can be installed.
trans-unit.target: On the **Requirements** page, select the requirements that must be met before the app can be installed.

trans-unit.source: Choose from:
trans-unit.target: Choose from:

trans-unit.source: **Architecture**.
trans-unit.target: **Architecture**.

trans-unit.source: Select whether this app can be installed on 32-bit, 64-bit, or both operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Select whether this app can be installed on 32-bit, 64-bit, or both operating systems.

trans-unit.source: **Operating System**.
trans-unit.target: **Operating System**.

trans-unit.source: Select the minimum operating system on which this app can be installed.
trans-unit.target: Select the minimum operating system on which this app can be installed.

trans-unit.source: On the **Detection rules** page, you can configure rules to detect whether the app that you are configuring is already installed on a PC.
trans-unit.target: On the **Detection rules** page, you can configure rules to detect whether the app that you are configuring is already installed on a PC.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can use the default detection rules to automatically overwrite any previously installed versions of the app.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can use the default detection rules to automatically overwrite any previously installed versions of the app.

trans-unit.source: This option is for Windows Installer (.exe files only).
trans-unit.target: This option is for Windows Installer (.exe files only).

trans-unit.source: The rules that you can configure are:
trans-unit.target: The rules that you can configure are:

trans-unit.source: **File exists**.
trans-unit.target: **File exists**.

trans-unit.source: Specify the path to the file that you want to detect.
trans-unit.target: Specify the path to the file that you want to detect.

trans-unit.source: You can search under **%ProgramFiles%** (which searches **Program Files**\<path> and **Program Files (x86)**\<path>) on the PC or **%SystemDrive%** (which searches from the root drive of the PC, typically drive C).
trans-unit.target: You can search under **%ProgramFiles%** (which searches **Program Files**\<path> and **Program Files (x86)**\<path>) on the PC or **%SystemDrive%** (which searches from the root drive of the PC, typically drive C).

trans-unit.source: **MSI product code exists**.
trans-unit.target: **MSI product code exists**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Browse** to choose the Windows Installer (.msi) file that you want to detect.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Browse** to choose the Windows Installer (.msi) file that you want to detect.

trans-unit.source: **Registry key exists**.
trans-unit.target: **Registry key exists**.

trans-unit.source: Specify a registry key that begins with **HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\**.
trans-unit.target: Specify a registry key that begins with **HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\**.

trans-unit.source: Both 32-bit and 64-bit registry paths are searched.
trans-unit.target: Both 32-bit and 64-bit registry paths are searched.

trans-unit.source: If the key that you specified exists in either location, the detection rule is satisfied.
trans-unit.target: If the key that you specified exists in either location, the detection rule is satisfied.

trans-unit.source: If the app satisfies any of the rules that you have configured, it will not be installed.
trans-unit.target: If the app satisfies any of the rules that you have configured, it will not be installed.

trans-unit.source: For the **Windows Installer** file type only (.msi and .exe): On the **Command line arguments** page, choose whether you want to supply optional command-line arguments for the installer.
trans-unit.target: For the **Windows Installer** file type only (.msi and .exe): On the **Command line arguments** page, choose whether you want to supply optional command-line arguments for the installer.

trans-unit.source: For example, some installers might support the argument **/q** to install silently with no user intervention.
trans-unit.target: For example, some installers might support the argument **/q** to install silently with no user intervention.

trans-unit.source: For the **Windows Installer** file type only (.exe only): On the **Return codes** page, you can add new error codes that Intune interprets when the app is installed on a managed Windows PC.
trans-unit.target: For the **Windows Installer** file type only (.exe only): On the **Return codes** page, you can add new error codes that Intune interprets when the app is installed on a managed Windows PC.

trans-unit.source: By default, Intune uses industry-standard return codes to report the failure or success of an app package installation: **0** (Success) or **3010** (Success with restart).
trans-unit.target: By default, Intune uses industry-standard return codes to report the failure or success of an app package installation: **0** (Success) or **3010** (Success with restart).

trans-unit.source: You can also add your own return codes to this list.
trans-unit.target: You can also add your own return codes to this list.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a list of return codes and the app installation returns a code that isn't on the list, it is interpreted as a failure.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a list of return codes and the app installation returns a code that isn't on the list, it is interpreted as a failure.

trans-unit.source: On the **Summary** page, review the information that you specified.
trans-unit.target: On the **Summary** page, review the information that you specified.

trans-unit.source: When you are ready, choose **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: When you are ready, choose **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Close** to finish.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Close** to finish.

trans-unit.source: The app is displayed on the **Apps** node of the **Apps** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The app is displayed on the **Apps** node of the **Apps** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: After you've created an app, the next step is to deploy it.
trans-unit.target: After you've created an app, the next step is to deploy it.

trans-unit.source: To find out more, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: To find out more, see [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps.md).
